com.ndi

Class EnumFormatValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ndi.EnumFormatValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.everit.json.schema.FormatValidator

    public class EnumFormatValidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.everit.json.schema.FormatValidator
    A very flexible FormatValidator that enables customizable format keywords. It allows users to create format tags for string that are not present in the Json Schema Official Specification. This validator can be used when we want to restrict an entry to a set of predefined values, but at the same time, provides hint when the user enters something close to our expected value. It extends the FormatValidator class, which is called by the Everit Validator when it encounters the user's defined format tag while traversing through the schema document

    Example usage:

     
         EnumFormatValidator.Builder builder = new EnumFormatValidator.Builder()
                 .setTableFormat(new TableFormat().addFormat(new String[]{"\t", "\t", "\t"})
                         .addEntryPattern(2, ", ")
                         .addEntryPattern(3, ", "))
                 .setFilePath("src/main/resources/GenBankControlledVocabulary.tsv.gz")
                 .setRules(new Rules().addExpectedColumn(Arrays.asList("Scientific_Name", "Synonyms"))
                         .addSuggestedColumn(Collections.singletonList("Other_Common_Name")))
                 .setFormatTag("animal_subject");
         FormatValidator fv = builder.build();
         System.out.println(fv.validate("cat"));

      Print out the following in the console:
          Optional[Entered: cat. Expected: any one of [Felis catus, Felis domesticus, Felis silvestris catus]]

      • buildFromJSON

        public static java.util.List<org.everit.json.schema.FormatValidator> buildFromJSON(org.json.JSONObject arg)
        Construct a list of EnumFormatValidator a JSON Object (see ndi_validate_config.json in the json document folder for reference)
        Parameters:
        arg - an org.json.JSONArray Object representing a list of valid JSONObject that can be used to construct an instance of EnumFormatValidator
        Returns:
        a List of EnumFormat Validators give the JSONArray input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the json files contains invalid data type

      • validateEnumFormatValidatorJSON

        public static void validateEnumFormatValidatorJSON(org.json.JSONObject arg)
        Validate the input JSONObject file using the com.ndi.Validator class. Doing so ensure JSONObject Exception will be not be thrown when the JSON Object is used to construct an instance of the EnumFormatValidator
        Parameters:
        arg - the input JSON object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input (JSONObject arg) is null or the JSON file is not formatted correctly according to ndi_document_subject_schema.json
        java.lang.InternalError - if the schema file can no longer be found

      • validate

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> validate(java.lang.String subject)
        Perform the validation of the JSON instance. If the user has entered an entry from a column listed in the Rules object's 'correct' field, the method returns an empty optional container. Otherwise, if the user has entered an entry from a column in on of the columns listed in the Rule object's 'suggestions' field, the method returns a String wrapped in the Optional container that provides hint in regards to where its corresponding entry in the 'correct' column would be. Otherwise, the validator tells user which columns are the expected columns and that the user's has not entered an entry from either the 'correct' column nor the 'suggestions' column
        Specified by:
        validate in interface org.everit.json.schema.FormatValidator
        Parameters:
        subject - the user input in that json entry
        Returns:
        List of error messages. The List would be empty if the user's entry is valid.
